Package Processing

Class FileProcessing

java.lang.Object
Processing.FileProcessing
public class FileProcessing
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents the process to build the Huffman Code given a File with at least and most one line of text. It accepts every character under UTF-8.
Author:
Ydiel Z. Flores Torres
See Also:
Map, File, BTNode, String, Integer

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start​(java.io.File input) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Receives an input File and calls all the other methods in the class to complete the Huffman Tree.
      Parameters:
      input - Receives a File object as parameter.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - Will throw an exception if the File that you are trying to read is not found.

    • loadData

      public java.lang.String loadData​(java.io.File input) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Receives a File and returns the first line as String.
      Parameters:
      input - Receives a File object as parameter.
      Returns:
      String Returns the first line of the parameter as a string.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - Throws an exception if the input is not found.

    • computeFD

      public ClassADT.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> computeFD​(java.lang.String input)
      Builds a Map with String and Integer pairing.
      Parameters:
      input - String to build a Map from.
      Returns:
      Map The Character from the parameter will be the Keys of this map as Strings. The value of each key will represent the frequency of each key in the input parameter.

    • huffmanTree

      public ClassADT.BinaryTreeNodePackage.BTNode<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> huffmanTree​(ClassADT.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> inputMap)
      Builds the binary tree representing the Huffman Tree.
      Parameters:
      inputMap - Receives a Map containing Strings as keys and Integers as values. The integers must be the frequencies of the keys in a String.
      Returns:
      BTNode Returns the root of the Huffman Tree (Binary Tree).

    • huffmanCode

      public ClassADT.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> huffmanCode​(ClassADT.BinaryTreeNodePackage.BTNode<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> root)
      Builds the mapping for the code that will represent each character of a String.
      Parameters:
      root - The parameter will be the root of a Binary Tree (object BTNode) representing the Huffman Tree.
      Returns:
      Map Returns a Map with Strings as keys and values. The keys will be each character in a String and the value will be the Huffman code for each character.

    • encode

      public java.lang.String encode​(ClassADT.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> codeMap, java.lang.String input)
      Builds a String that represents the encoded version of the input String.
      Parameters:
      codeMap - Receives a Map containing Strings as values and keys. The keys will be each character of a given String and the keys will be the Huffman Code for each key.
      input - The string to be encoded.
      Returns:
      Returns the encoded input.

    • processResults

      public void processResults​(ClassADT.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> codeMap, java.lang.String inputString, ClassADT.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> mapWithFrequencies, java.lang.String encodedString)
      Prints the results of the Huffman Code into the console.
      Parameters:
      codeMap - Receives a Map containing Strings as values and keys. The keys will be each character of a given String and the keys will be the Huffman Code for each key.
      inputString - Receives the initial input String.
      mapWithFrequencies - Receives a Map containing Strings as keys and Integers as values. The integers must be the frequencies of the keys in a String.
      encodedString - Receives the encoded String of the initial input String.

    • randomizer

      public void randomizer​(int stringSize)
      //|| This method generates a random string and starts the process of making the encoding for the Huffman Code. //|| //||
      Parameters:
      stringSize - This inputs represents the length of the string to be generated. //||
